channel.title: swift - Programming adventures by sunshinejr
channel.description: Recent content in swift - Programming adventures by sunshinejr

item.title: Stop force unwrapping IBOutlets with @Delayed
item.description: Take a look at how Property Wrappers can remove the need of using both IBOutlets and force-unwrapping.

item.title: Open Source Adventures #6 - Gifski
item.description: How I started doing macOS apps and improved my favorite GIF client.

item.title: Using Xcode Preview with your production code
item.description: Everyone is happy for SwiftUI, but a lot of production code won't be able to use it for a while. Don't worry though - you can still prototype your views using the newest Xcode Preview.

item.title: Open Source Adventures #5 - SwiftyUserDefaults
item.description: A story of how I stole another library and almost ruined it for everyone.

item.title: SwiftyUserDefaults 4.0
item.description: After a year of work, we finally released version 4.

item.title: Open Source Adventures #4 - Harvey
item.description: A retrospection of Moya's testing library.

item.title: Open Source Adventures #3 - Carthage
item.description: When there is a problem with a certain library in a certain package manager, should it be resolved by a library or the package manager itself? ðŸ¤”

item.title: Open Source Adventures #2 - Marathon
item.description: 5h Marathon of fixing tests on Linux! I think I've got a good time!

item.title: Scaling Moya in production
item.description: There is a big misconception that Moya is not scalable in the real world. People often see it as a "big enum of death". Today, I want to show you that this is in fact not true at all.
